{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3630681,"name":"DW - [Bk] Mentor","username":"dwwright","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dwwright/{size}/160502_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-20T21:08:22.262Z","cooked":"

Seems like a good price for a machine with these specs ($11,000 router for $3,000).

Too good to be true?

https://baileigh.com/cnc-router-table-wr-32

I’d imagine it means they are discontinuing the product. Their lower end machines are mostly rebadged from what I could tell. We have a horizontal bandsaw and it’s been okay, but has been a bear to keep running straight.

We’ve had a Baleigh router for years. Works fine. The spindle wasn’t super perpendicular to the table, but 0.1" of shim fixed that IIRC it doesn’t understand the Gcode for arcs, so you need to use facets.

Yeah, its totally an Asian router with their branding.
The brain on ours is a Weihong NK105G2. I had to swap the pendant after the kids dropped it for the 5 millionth time

Glad to help! Let me know if you need anything else! You can look up the brain information pretty readily. Baleigh’s info is also acceptably reach-able.

Our unit has a separate brain cabinet, so the stand is really sheet metal covers over a box tube frame. I keep thinking that I need to remove the covers and turn it into storage!

They appear to be selling one of the WR-32 as a scratch and dent for $7263. That may be a unit that was returned for some reason.

https://baileigh.com/woodworking/used-demo-machines/

Baleigh stuff in general isn’t fantastic, but it’s not terrible either. For $3k I’d buy it, but I’d do so knowing what I might be getting into in that it may not be a turnkey machine. For $11k I wouldn’t touch it.
